Man, that question when you can't even predict next month - 5 years feels like a joke when right now is so uncertain. Kya bolun ye confusion is real. Are koi nai yaar, most people don't know honestly, they just make it up. What do you usually say?
Maa roti hai kabhi kabhi chupke se. Unhe lagta main nahi dekhta. Par main dekh leta hoon. Unke tears meri wajah se hain. Yeh sab nahi saha jata.

Mere dost, maa ko chupke rote dekhna aur jaanna ki wo tears tere struggle ki wajah se - that guilt is unbearable when you're the cause of their pain. Unhe weak dekhna jab wo hamesha strong thi. Kya kabhi baat ki hai unse directly is baare mein?
Resume mein kya likhun? Ek bhi internship nahi ki. Projects bhi basic hain. Competitions mein participate nahi kiya. Literally empty resume hai.

Yaar that blank resume feeling jab compare karte ho doosron se - no internships, basic projects, no competitions. Empty lagta hai sab. But dekh, everyone starts somewhere na yaar. Kya college mein koi clubs ya volunteering kiya tha?
Got scammed by a fake job posting. Paid registration fees. They disappeared. Lost 15k. Feel so stupid. Desperate times making me do desperate things.

Damn, got scammed 15k in fake job posting - that desperation made you vulnerable and they took advantage. Feeling stupid when you were just trying to find work, that's not fair on yourself. Arre but yaar, scammers are professionals at this. Have you reported it anywhere?
Sab coding seekh rahe. Main bhi try kiya but samajh nahi aata. Ab lagta hai main bas humanities mein hi theek tha. Par wahan job toh aur nahi hai.

Arre yaar, coding try kiya but click nahi hua aur humanities mein better tha - but wahan jobs kam hain toh trapped feel hota hai. Koi nai, coding sab ke liye nahi hoti. Humanities mein kya options explore kiye tune?
Neighbor's kid got into IIT. Mere ghar waale unhe example dete hain. Main toh normal college se bhi kuch nahi kar paya. That comparison kills me daily.

Mere dost, neighbor ka IIT kid constant example aur ghar waale compare karte - that daily reminder ki tu enough nahi hai is killing you slowly. Their success weapon ban gayi against you. How often does this comparison happen?
Har rejection email padhke thoda aur toot jata hoon. Save kar rakha hai sab. 347 rejection emails hain ab tak. Count karta hoon kabhi kabhi.

Uff yaar, 347 rejection emails save karke rakhna aur count karna - that's keeping score of every failure, har ek reminder ki nahi hua. That pain ko hold kiye rehna instead of letting go. Kyun save karta hai unhe?
Meri girlfriend ka family pooch raha kya karta hoon. Usko jhooth bolna pad raha meri wajah se. Uske parents impressed nahi honge agar pata chala. Relationship risk mein hai.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Girlfriend ko jhooth bolna pad raha uske family ko aur uske parents impress nahi honge truth jaanke - that fear ki relationship khatam ho jayegi. She's protecting you but how long, right? Kya wo supportive hai is struggle mein?
Started therapy but had to stop because can't afford it anymore. Just when I was making progress. Now back to square one with no support.

Damn, therapy helping but had to stop kyunki afford nahi kar sakte - just when progress ho raha tha, back to square one. That loss of support when you finally found it, so frustrating. Are there any free or low-cost options you looked into?
College reunion aa raha. Obviously nahi ja raha. Sab apni achievements ke baare mein baat karenge. Mere paas kuch nahi hai bolne ko. Embarrassing hoga.

Arre yaar, reunion mein sab achievements flex karenge aur tere paas kuch nahi - that embarrassment ka dar when you'll be the only one with nothing. Obviously skip karna safer lagta hai. Koi close friends ja rahe hain jo situation jaante hain?
Government job ka exam prepare kar raha. Private mein nahi ho raha toh. But years lag sakte hain crack karne mein. Uss time tak kya karunga?

Samajh raha hoon mere dost. Private nahi hua toh government try kar raha but years lag sakte - wo uncertainty ki uss time tak kya hoga, waiting period ka dar. Are but yaar, at least direction toh hai na. Kitne time se prep kar raha hai?
My parents sacrificed their dreams so I could study. Now I can't even get a basic job. What was the point of all their sacrifice? I ruined it all.

Man, parents sacrificed their dreams for your education and now you feel you ruined it all by not getting placed - that guilt of wasting their sacrifice is crushing you. Their hopes were on you and you feel you let them down completely. Have they said anything about this?
Aptitude tests mein fail ho jata continuously. Logical reasoning weak hai. Practice karta hoon par improve nahi ho raha. Ek barrier hai jo cross nahi kar pa raha.

Yaar that frustration jab practice kar rahe ho but improve nahi - aptitude tests mein wo barrier feel hota hai jo cross nahi hota. Logical reasoning stuck hai despite trying. Koi nai, everyone has weak areas. Kya specific topics mein struggle hai ya overall?
Diwali aa rahi. Pichle saal socha tha is Diwali tak job hogi. Wahi hoon jahan the. Ek saal waste ho gaya. Celebration ka mood nahi hai.

Arre mere dost, pichle Diwali pe socha tha is baar job hogi but wahi ka wahi - that reminder ki ek saal waste when festival comes. Celebration nahi kar pa raha kyunki kuch badla nahi. That's painful yaar. Ghar waale kya keh rahe hain?
Heard through friends that companies are doing background checks on social media. My profiles show I haven't done anything noteworthy. Even that's working against me now.

Damn, even social media profiles working against you kyunki nothing noteworthy - every aspect feels like it's revealing your lack of achievements. That anxiety when even online presence isn't good enough. Arre but yaar, most people's socials are pretty basic. Are you overthinking this maybe?
Chhote bhai ko dekho mere mistakes se seekh raha. Wo already sahi path pe hai internships wagera kar raha. Main galat example ban gaya uske liye.

Uff yaar, chhota bhai tere mistakes se seekh ke sahi kar raha aur tu galat example ban gaya - that reversal when younger one is doing better. Your struggle became his lesson but at your cost. That must sting. Kya wo supportive hai tere sath?
Jo log college mein below average the wo bhi placed hain. Main above average tha academically. Still unemployed. Merit ka koi matlab nahi hai kya?

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Below average log placed aur tu above average tha academically but unemployed - that unfairness ki merit doesn't matter feels like biggest betrayal. System broken lagti hai. Are but grades are just one thing na, interview alag game hai. Kya hota hai interviews mein tera?
Keep having dreams about getting a job offer and then waking up to reality. That disappointment every morning is getting harder to handle. Dreams feel cruel now.

Man, those dreams of job offers and waking up to harsh reality - that morning disappointment repeatedly is wearing you down. Dreams becoming cruel reminders instead of escape. That emotional whiplash daily is exhausting. How often is this happening?
Bachelors khatam ho gayi. Masters karne ka paisa nahi. Skill development courses bhi expensive hain. Kaise aage badhu? Stuck hoon completely.

Arre yaar, bachelors done but masters ka paisa nahi aur skills courses bhi expensive - aage badhne ka raasta dikhta nahi. Financially stuck when every option costs money. Koi nai yaar, free resources bhi hain bohot. Kaunse field mein upskill karna chahta hai?
Interview mein bola I'm not passionate enough. How do I show passion for a field I'm desperate to enter just for survival? Passion is a luxury I can't afford.

Damn, they want passion when you're just trying to survive - that privilege of being passionate when you need any job to live. Passion luxury ban gayi hai jo afford nahi kar sakte. That's so frustrating yaar. What field was this for?
Chacha ne apne bete ko company mein referral diya. Wo turant lag gaya. Mere paas koi connections nahi. Nepotism dekh ke lagta hai bina connections ke kuch nahi hota.

Uff yaar, chacha ka beta referral se lag gaya aur tere paas koi connection nahi - that unfairness ki bina connections ke mehnat bhi kaam nahi aati. System rigged lagti hai. Are but yaar, LinkedIn pe try kiya hai kisi se connect hone ka?
Ghar mein electricity bill, grocery sab mein contribute nahi kar pa raha. Chhoti chhoti cheezon mein bhi dependent hoon. Feel like a burden on my own family.

Mere dost, electricity bill tak contribute nahi kar pa raha aur burden feel karna apne hi ghar mein - that helplessness when you can't help with basics. Your own family mein dependent hona guilt lata hai. Kitne time se ye feel kar raha hai?
Tried changing my resume format ten times. Tried different keywords. Nothing works. Same result everywhere. Maybe the problem is me, not the resume.

Man, ten different resume formats aur keywords change kiye but same result - that makes you feel the problem isn't the resume, it's you. That shift from fixing format to fixing yourself is painful. Arre but yaar, sometimes it's just timing and luck. Are you getting interviews at all?
Sab bol rahe relocate karo metro city mein. Par bina job ke kaise jaun? Rent, khana, sab expensive hai. Ghar se door akele rahna bhi afford nahi kar sakta.

Arre yaar, relocate karo bolte but bina job ke metro mein survive kaise - rent, khana sab expensive when income zero hai. That advice sounds good but practically impossible. Koi nai, timing ki baat hai. Kya dost hain metro mein jo temporarily help kar sakte?
College fest mein judges mein se ek mere interview lene wala tha. Unhone reject kar diya tha mujhe. Unhe wahan dekhke sab yaad aa gaya. Panic ho gaya.

Uff mere dost, fest mein wo judge jo tujhe reject kiya tha - unhe dekhke sab yaad aana aur panic hona, that trigger is real. That shame rushing back when you see them. Kya hua fest mein? Baat hui unse?
Pehle dream company thi Google, Microsoft wagera. Ab toh koi bhi le le bas. Dreams se compromise kar raha slowly. Desperation aa gayi hai.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Pehle Google, Microsoft dream the ab koi bhi le le - that shift from dreams to desperation when survival becomes priority. Compromise kar raha hai kyunki choice nahi hai. Are but yaar, first job kahi bhi ho, stepping stone hai. Abhi kya apply kar raha hai?
Started smoking to deal with the stress. Know it's bad but it's the only thing that calms me down temporarily. Adding one more problem to the list.

Man, smoking to cope with stress kyunki it's the only temporary relief - knowing it's bad but doing it anyway when nothing else helps. Adding health issues to existing problems. That desperation for any escape is real yaar. How often has this been happening?
Alumni network join kiya help ke liye. Par sab busy hain apni life mein. Reply hi nahi karte. Feel invisible completely. Koi help nahi kar raha.

Arre yaar, alumni se help maangi but sab busy aur reply nahi - invisible feel hona when you're reaching out. Koi help nahi kar raha jab chahiye. That rejection from your own college people stings. Kitne logo ko message kiya tha?
Nani ne socha tha main doctor banunga. Unki last wish thi. Wo chali gayi aur main abhi bhi struggle kar raha engineering mein. Unhe face nahi kar paya life mein.

Mere dost, nani ki last wish doctor banna aur wo chali gayi while tu engineering mein struggle - unhe face nahi kar paya when they were alive. That regret of unfulfilled wishes when they're gone, so heavy. Kya family ne kuch pressure diya tha is baare mein?
Ghar ke chhat pe jata hoon raat ko akele. Sochta hoon sab kuch. Zyada overthink ho jata hai. Kabhi kabhi darr lagta hai khud se ki kahin kuch galat na kar loon.

Yaar yeh bohot serious lag raha hai. Raat ko chhat pe akele jana aur overthink karna, aur darr lagta hai khud se - that's heavy. Please kisi se baat karo - counselor, parent, koi bhi trust karta hai. Tele-MANAS 14416 pe call kar sakta hai abhi. Tu important hai mere dost.
Interview preparation ke liye paid course join kiya loan leke. Course bhi complete nahi kar paya properly. Ab loan bhi hai aur skill bhi develop nahi hui. Double loss.

Uff mere dost, loan leke course liya but complete nahi kar paya - ab loan ka burden aur skills bhi nahi develop hui. Double loss when investment didn't pay off. That guilt of wasted money and opportunity. Kya hua ki complete nahi kar paya?
Everyone keeps asking when will you settle down. I don't even have a job to think about marriage. That pressure is suffocating. One step at a time but nobody understands.

Man, settle down ka pressure when you don't even have a job - that suffocation when everyone's ahead of you in life milestones. One step at a time makes sense but they don't get it. Are koi nai yaar, everyone has their own timeline. Kya family actively pressure kar rahi hai?
Roz ek baar toh sochta hoon sab chhod du. Kisi gaon mein chala jaun jahan expectations nahi hain. Yeh race se thak gaya hoon. Escape karne ka mann karta.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Roz ek baar escape ka thought - sab chhod ke kahin chale jaana jahan expectations zero hain. That exhaustion from constant race and pressure. Arre but running away won't solve it na, problems saath jaate hain. Kya specifically zyada overwhelm kar raha hai?
Dosto ne group banaya hai sab employed logo ka. Main wahi purane group mein akela unemployed hoon. Feel excluded even when they don't mean to. Their lives moved on.

Arre yaar, employed logo ka alag group aur tu purane mein akela unemployed - excluded feel hona even when they don't mean it. Their lives moved on and tu stuck, that gap widens daily. Kya wo log abhi bhi touch mein hain tere sath?
Got rejected after final round yesterday. Was so close. Cried for the first time in years. Felt like my last hope. Don't know how much more I can take.

Damn, final round reject when you were so close - crying after years means it broke something deep inside. That last hope feeling shattered. You're carrying so much yaar. That's okay to break down, doesn't make you weak. Kya reason diya unhone rejection ka?
Maa ke birthday pe gift nahi de paya. Paise nahi the. Unhone kuch nahi bola par unki aankhon mein disappointment dekhi. Wo choti si baat bhi itni badi lag gayi.

Uff mere dost, maa ko birthday pe gift nahi de paya aur unki aankhon mein disappointment - wo silence louder than words. Choti baat but tere liye bohot badi kyunki financially helpless feel hua. That guilt is heavy yaar. Kya unhone really kuch expect kiya tha?
Internship thi unpaid. Wo bhi nahi kar paya complete kyunki ghar ka kharcha contribute karna tha. Halfway chhod diya. Certificate bhi nahi mila. Resume mein daal bhi nahi sakta.

Yaar that sucks, unpaid internship bhi nahi kar paya complete kyunki ghar ka kharcha tha - halfway chhodna and certificate na milna means resume mein wo bhi nahi daal sakte. That loss of opportunity when survival took priority. Koi nai yaar, you did what you had to. Kitne time kiya tha?
Classmate started his own startup. Failed once, trying again. Here I am scared to even apply sometimes. His courage vs my fear. Feel like such a coward.

Man, classmate failing and trying again while you're scared to apply - that comparison making you feel like a coward. But yaar, different people different situations na. His courage doesn't make your caution cowardice. Are you scared of rejection or something else?
Papa retire ho gaye last month. Ab main officially unemployed hoon aur papa bhi. Ghar mein koi earning member nahi. Savings khatam ho rahe dheere dheere. Bohot darr lag raha.

Mere dost, papa retired aur tu unemployed - ghar mein koi earning nahi aur savings khatam ho rahe. That panic when financial security disappearing fast. Bohot darr lagta hai yaar jab cushion khatam ho. Kya koi emergency plan socha hai family ne?
Job fair mein gaya tha. Line mein ghante khade rahe. Resume jama kiya. Koi response nahi. Aise 5-6 job fairs attend kar chuka. Same result har baar. Efforts waste lag rahe.

Uff yaar, 5-6 job fairs ghante line mein khade rahe aur koi response nahi - same result har baar makes efforts feel completely waste. That physical exhaustion plus emotional defeat. Arre but yaar, at least trying kar raha hai consistently. Kya follow up kiya tha baad mein?
Sometimes I wonder if I'm just not smart enough for today's job market. Maybe I'm fundamentally inadequate. These thoughts consume me at night.

Man, those night thoughts that maybe you're just not smart enough - questioning your fundamental adequacy when rejections pile up. That self-doubt consuming you in darkness is painful yaar. But not getting job doesn't mean not smart enough, market is tough for everyone. Kab se ye thoughts zyada intense ho gaye?
Coaching teacher ne motivational speech di thi. Bola mehnat karoge toh result milega. Maine mehnat ki. Result nahi mila. Feel cheated by that advice. Mehnat ka koi guarantee nahi hai.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Teacher ne promise kiya mehnat se result but tune mehnat ki aur result nahi - cheated feel hona when advice didn't work for you. That bitterness when hard work guarantee nahi hai. Are but yaar, mehnat waste nahi hai, timing ka bhi role hai. Kya sab mehnat barbaad lagi?
Neighbors ki baatein sunai deti hain. Mere baare mein baat karte. Unemployed hai abhi tak. Ghar walon ko bhi sunna padta. Embarrassment ka level next hai.

Arre mere dost, neighbors ki baatein about you being unemployed aur ghar walon ko bhi sunna - that public embarrassment when private struggle becomes gossip. Next level shame when everyone knows. Kya ghar waale react karte hain jab wo sab bolte?
Freelancing try ki. Client ne payment nahi kiya. 3 mahine ka kaam kiya. Block kar diya mujhe. Legal action lene ke paise bhi nahi. Helpless hoon completely.

Uff yaar, 3 mahine kaam kiya freelancing aur client ne payment nahi kiya aur block - that exploitation when you're helpless without money for legal help. Completely powerless feel hona. That sucks so much. Kya koi platform tha jahan ye hua ya direct?
Behen ki fees bharni hai next month. Maa ne mujhse poochna band kar diya. Seedhe papa se bolti hai. Unhe pata hai mere paas kuch nahi. Wo silent treatment hurts.

Mere dost, behen ki fees ke liye maa seedhe papa se bolti ab - tujhse poochna hi band because they know you have nothing. That silent exclusion when they stop expecting from you, hurts more than asking. Koi nai yaar, wo samajh rahi hain situation. Kya tu kuch contribute kar paya hai pehle kabhi?
WhatsApp status pe sabke job updates dekhta hoon. Main status daal hi nahi sakta. Kya dalunga? Unemployed hoon abhi bhi? Delete kar diya app temporarily.

Arre yaar, WhatsApp status pe sabke job updates aur tu daal hi nahi sakta kyunki kya dalega - unemployed status? App delete karna protection hai us constant reminder se. That's okay yaar, social media break helps sometimes. Kab se delete kiya hai?
Interview mein overqualified bolke reject kar diya. Underqualified toh samajh aata. Overqualified ka kya matlab? Qualification bhi galat hai ab? Kuch samajh nahi aa raha.

Yaar that's confusing, overqualified bolke reject when you thought more qualification would help - matlab kuch bhi galat hai. Underqualified, overqualified, perfect qualified kya hai? That frustration when you can't win either way. Koi nai, sometimes it's just excuse. Kaunsi role ke liye tha ye?
Raat ko 2-3 baje tak jagta hoon applications bharte bharte. Din mein neend aati. Schedule completely reversed. Health bhi kharab ho rahi slowly. Par kya karun?

Uff yaar, raat 2-3 baje tak applications aur din mein sona - schedule reversed and health kharab hona when desperation forces bad habits. That sacrifice of wellbeing for job search. Are but yaar, health bhi important hai na. Kitne din se ye chal raha?
Mummy bol rahi thi adjust kar le kisi bhi job mein. Standards kam kar de. Matlab meri mehnat ka itna hi value hai? Koi bhi job? Hurt hua sunke.

Arre mere dost, mummy ka adjust kar le bolna aur standards kam kar - that hurt when your own mother says settle for anything. Mehnat ka value zero feel hota hai. But yaar, wo struggle dekh ke practical advice de rahi maybe, worried hain. Kya wo usually supportive hain ya pressure zyada deti hain?
College reunion invitation aayi. RSVP nahi kiya. Can't face everyone. They'll ask what I'm doing. Don't have an answer that won't make me look like a failure.

Man, reunion invitation and you can't face the question of what you're doing - no answer that won't expose the struggle. That shame of looking like failure in front of everyone. Skipping feels safer than explaining. Does anyone from college know your situation?
Dadi bimar hain. Unko ek baar job milne ki khushi dikhana chahta tha. Lagta nahi wo din aayega unke rehte. Guilt bohot hai ki unhe khush nahi kar paya.

Mere dost, dadi bimar aur unhe job milne ki khushi dikhana chahta tha but time running out - that guilt of not making them happy before it's too late. So heavy yaar when you wanted to give them that one joy. Kya unse baat hoti hai abhi bhi?
Portfolio banane ke liye projects chahiye. Projects karne ka time nahi kyunki applications bhar raha. Applications ke liye portfolio chahiye. Stuck in loop. Kaise todu yeh cycle?

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Portfolio ke liye projects but time nahi kyunki applications, applications ke liye portfolio - that loop jahan dono ek doosre pe depend karte. Breaking point nahi dikh raha. Are koi nai, small project se shuru kar sakta slowly. Kaunse field mein portfolio banana hai?
Bhai ki engagement hai next month. Mujhse shopping ke liye paise maange the. Mana karna pada. Unhe samajh aa gaya situation. Par guilt bohot hai ki bhai ke khushi mein participate nahi kar paya.

Uff mere dost, bhai ki engagement mein shopping ka paisa nahi de paya - mana karna pada and wo samajh gaye situation. That guilt of not participating in his happiness when you want to. Financial helplessness in family moments hurts separately. Kya unhone kuch bola tha?
Job consultancy ne paisa liya. Promise kiya placement hogi. 6 mahine ho gaye kuch nahi hua. Scam tha shayad. Complaint karne gaya toh office hi band mila. Paise doob gaye.

Yaar that sucks so much, consultancy ne paisa leke scam kiya aur office band - paise doob gaye completely. That betrayal when they promised help and ran away. Kitna paisa tha aur kya koi legal option hai?
Mera birthday month hai. Usually khush rehta par is baar dread ho raha. One more year older with nothing to show. Age badh rahi achievement nahi.

Arre yaar, birthday aur dread feel hona kyunki one more year with nothing to show - age badh rahi but achievements nahi. That reminder when celebrations become painful. Are but yaar, you're still young and trying. Kitne ka ho raha hai?
Read somewhere that employers see gaps in employment as red flags. My gap is growing every month. Feels like digging my own grave. The longer I stay unemployed, the harder it gets.

Man, that gap growing every month and knowing employers see it as red flag - feels like trapped in quicksand where struggling makes it worse. Digging your own grave when time passing is working against you. That's scary yaar. How long has the gap been now?
Ghar mein ladai hoti roz meri wajah se. Maa baap fight karte ki maine galat parenting ki ya situation ki galti hai. Main reason ban gaya family ke problems ka.

Uff mere dost, roz ghar mein ladai tere wajah se aur tu reason ban gaya sab problems ka - that guilt when you're causing parents to fight. Family harmony toot rahi hai struggle ki wajah se. That's so heavy yaar. Kya directly tujhe blame karte ya apas mein?
Coaching classes mein junior batch ko padhate hue dekha khud ko. Wo log college mein hain main unemployed graduate. Teaching them so I don't have to face reality. Feels pathetic.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Junior batch ko padhana when you're unemployed graduate - that reversal when they're ahead in journey. Teaching to avoid reality feels pathetic. Are but koi nai, earning something is better than nothing na. Kya pay mil raha hai?
Phone ka data khatam hota constantly. Wifi nahi hai ghar pe. Cyber cafe jaana padta applications bharne. Wahan bhi paisa lagta. Har cheez mein struggle hai.

Arre mere dost, phone data khatam aur wifi nahi toh cyber cafe jaana padta - wahan bhi paisa when you have nothing. Har step mein struggle when basic things like internet bhi luxury hai. That's tough yaar. Kya library mein free wifi hai kahi?
Maa ne jewelry bechne ki baat ki ghar chalane ke liye. Main wajah hoon unhe apni jewelry bechni pad rahi. Kaise jiyun is guilt ke saath? Unki life bhar ki kamai ja rahi.

Mere dost, maa ko jewelry bechni pad rahi ghar chalane aur tu reason hai - that guilt when their lifetime savings going because of you. Unki sacrifice directly dekh raha hai. Yaar yeh bohot heavy hai. Kya unhone actually bech diya ya abhi soch rahi hain?
Interview preparation videos dekhta hoon YouTube pe. Comments mein log success stories likhte. Motivate hone ke bajaye jealous feel hota. Unke liye kaam kiya mere liye kyun nahi?

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Success stories padhke jealous feel hona instead of motivated - unke liye work kiya toh tere liye kyun nahi, that question eats you up. Koi nai yaar, everyone's journey different hai. Kya same strategies try ki tune?
Relative ki shaadi mein sab successful log the. Main corner mein baitha tha akele. Koi baat nahi karna chahta unemployed se. Invisible feel hua. Ghost ban gaya.

Uff yaar, shaadi mein corner mein akele kyunki koi baat nahi karna chahta unemployed se - invisible feel hona jab sab ignore karte. Ghost ban gaya when you're physically there but socially absent. That isolation in crowd hurts differently. Kya koi close family member tha saath?
Stopped updating my LinkedIn. What's the point? No achievements to post. No job to update. Profile looks dead and so does my career. Gave up maintaining it.

Man, LinkedIn profile dead kyunki koi updates nahi - no achievements, no job, gave up maintaining it. That digital abandonment when it reminds you of failure. Are but yaar, active profile helps with visibility sometimes. When did you last update it?
Papa ne kaha tha engineer banega toh set ho jayega. Maine unki baat maan li. Ab wo khud regret karte lag rahe. Unhe bhi lagta maine galat guide kiya. Dono guilty hain.

Mere dost, papa ne guide kiya engineer ban aur ab wo bhi regret kar rahe - dono guilty feel kar rahe when it didn't work out. That shared disappointment when their advice didn't deliver. Arre but yaar, wo tere best ke liye socha tha. Kya wo directly bola hai regret ke baare mein?
Khud se hi baat karta hoon kabhi kabhi. Koi sunne wala nahi hai. Pagal sa lag raha slowly. Isolation ne mental state kharab kar di. Need human connection.

Yaar that loneliness when khud se baat karni padti - isolation ne mental state affect kar diya and human connection ki zaroorat hai. That's okay to feel yaar, everyone needs people. Kya koi friend ya family member hai jisse regular baat kar sakta?
Behen choti hai par already samajh gayi hai situation. Mujhe dekhke bolti apni bhai jaisa mat banna. Wo words bohot chubhte. Apni behen ke liye bad example.

Yaar that hurts, choti behen bol rahi bhai jaisa mat banna - wo words when you're bad example for your own sister. That pain when you wanted to be her inspiration but became warning. Kitni choti hai wo aur kya directly tere saamne boli?
Medical issues starting because of stress. Blood pressure, acidity, headaches. Can't afford proper treatment. One problem creating ten more. Spiral downward hai pure.

Man, stress causing medical issues and can't afford treatment - one problem multiplying into ten more. That downward spiral when health failing adds to existing burden. This is serious yaar. Are there any free health camps or government hospitals you can check?
Pichle saal is time interview crack kiya tha ek. Offer letter aayi thi. Company shut down ho gayi pandemic mein. Offer cancel. Tab se downhill. Wo ek chance tha.

Arre yaar, offer letter mila tha but company shutdown - wo ek chance cancel ho gaya and tab se downhill. That bad luck when you finally got it but external factors snatched it away. So close yet so far. Kya pandemic ke baad try kiya wahan dubara?
Maa roti hai chupke. Papa sharab peene lage. Behen padhai mein dhyan nahi de rahi. Sab meri wajah se family toot rahi. Main curse hoon ghar ke liye.

Mere dost, maa roti, papa drinking, behen padhai chhod rahi - sab teri wajah se family breaking aur tu curse feel kar raha. Yaar yeh bohot serious hai. Please kisi counselor se baat kar ya Tele-MANAS 14416 call kar. Family ko bhi help chahiye and tujhe bhi. Tu curse nahi hai, situation tough hai.
Interview mein ek question tha about handling failure. Ironically I'm expert at failing now. Couldn't answer properly because truth was too depressing. Failed that interview too.

Damn, question about handling failure when you're living it daily - truth too depressing to share so couldn't answer properly. That irony when your expertise is failure itself. Arre but yaar, persistence despite failure is handling it in a way. What did you end up saying?
Society mein log taunt marte. Padhe likhe hoke kya kar rahe ho? Sharam nahi aati? Public humiliation constant hai. Ghar se bahar nikalte darr lagta.

Uff yaar, society ke taunts aur public humiliation - padhe likhe ho aur unemployed, sharam nahi aati bolte. Ghar se nikalte darr lagta hai face karne se. That social pressure when even stepping out becomes anxiety. Koi nai mere dost, unhe ignore karna seekhna padega. Kya family support karti hai ya wo bhi?
Tried to learn new skill online. Course halfway chhod diya. Motivation zero. Can't focus on anything. Even self-improvement feels pointless. Giving up on improving myself.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Course start kiya but motivation zero - halfway chhod diya kyunki focus nahi aur self-improvement pointless lagti. That defeat when even trying to improve feels waste. Are but koi nai, break leke restart kar sakta slowly. Kaunsa skill tha?
Best friend got engaged. Didn't invite me. Guess unemployed friend is embarrassing for their professional circle. Lost friendship because I'm not successful enough. Hurts.

Man, best friend didn't invite you to engagement kyunki unemployed friend is embarrassing - that betrayal when success determines friendship value. Lost them because you're not successful enough, that rejection cuts deep. Did you talk to them about why they didn't invite you?
Bank balance 200 rupees hai. ATM minimum 500 nikalti. Wo bhi nahi kar sakta withdraw. Literally broke hoon. Koi emergency aayi toh kya karunga? Darr constant hai.

Arre mere dost, bank balance 200 aur ATM minimum 500 - literally broke when emergency bhi handle nahi kar sakte. That constant fear jab safety net zero hai. Bohot scary situation hai yaar. Kya family ko pata hai kitna tight hai financially?
Har rejection ke baad thoda aur dead feel hota hoon andar se. Numbness aa gayi hai ab. Pain bhi mehsoos nahi hota. Emotionally shut down ho gaya hoon.

Uff yaar, har rejection ke baad thoda dead feel hona and now complete numbness - emotionally shut down when pain bhi feel nahi hota. That protective numbness when feeling hurts too much. Koi nai mere dost, that's your mind protecting you. Kab se ye numbness hai?
Ghar mein mera kamra sabse chhota hai. Bhai ka bada hai kyunki wo earning hai. Physically bhi second class citizen ban gaya. Space bhi deserve nahi karta lagta.

Yaar that's painful, chhota kamra kyunki earning nahi - physically second class citizen when bhai gets bigger room. Space bhi deserve nahi karta feel hona when your worth measured by income. That hierarchy in own home hurts. Kya parents ne directly aisa kaha tha?
Tried to talk to career counselor. They charged 5000 per session. Can't afford it. Free resources are generic and useless. Paid help is out of reach. Stuck with bad advice or no advice.

Damn, career counselor wants 5000 per session and free resources too generic - stuck between bad advice and no advice when you can't afford help. That frustration when even guidance costs money you don't have. Are there any college counselors or free government services you could try?
Papa ki tabiyat kharab hai. Treatment ke liye paisa chahiye. Main kuch contribute nahi kar pa raha. Bhai akela sab manage kar raha. Useless son hoon main.

Mere dost, papa bimar aur tu contribute nahi kar pa raha while bhai sab manage kar raha - useless son feel karna when needed most. That helplessness when family crisis and you can't help financially. Bohot heavy hai yaar. Kya papa ki condition serious hai?
Sab kehte experience gain karo. Par experience ke liye job chahiye. Job ke liye experience. Koi first chance hi nahi de raha. System hi flawed hai.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Experience ke liye job, job ke liye experience - koi first chance nahi de raha toh start kaise karein. That frustration when system itself blocks entry. Are koi nai, internships ya small projects se bhi experience count hoti. Kya try kiya hai?
My college topper is working at Google. I was second topper. Now unemployed. One rank difference and such different outcomes. Merit doesn't guarantee anything apparently.

Man, one rank difference - topper at Google and you unemployed. That shows merit doesn't guarantee outcomes like everyone promised. So unfair yaar when you were almost equal academically. What do you think made the difference in placements?
Diwali bonus dene wale the papa ko. Wo maine socha tha apne liye kuch lunga. Par bonus cut ho gaya kyunki company loss mein. Mere sapne bhi cut ho gaye.

Uff yaar, papa ka bonus cut ho gaya aur teri expectations bhi - apne liye kuch lene ka sapna cut when company loss mein. That disappointment when small hope bhi crush ho jaye. Koi nai mere dost, next time milega. Kya lena chahta tha?
Confidence itna low hai ki mirror mein dekhna mushkil ho gaya. Khud se hi nafrat hone lagi hai. This self-hatred is consuming me completely.

Yaar that's really painful, mirror mein dekhna mushkil and self-hatred consuming you - when you can't even face yourself. That's a dark place mere dost. Please consider talking to someone, this level of self-hatred needs support. Kab se itna intense feel ho raha hai?
Got interview at startup. Salary was 15k per month. Couldn't take it because rent alone is 12k in that city. Math doesn't work. Dreams versus reality, reality wins.

Man, interview cleared but 15k salary when rent is 12k - math doesn't work out so had to reject. Dreams versus reality and reality crushing dreams. That's frustrating when opportunity there but financially impossible. Did you try negotiating or asking for remote option?
Bachpan se doctor banne ka sapna tha. Parents ne engineering karwai. Ab engineer bhi nahi ban paya properly. Sapna bhi gaya career bhi nahi. Dono taraf se haar gaya.

Arre mere dost, doctor banne ka sapna but parents ne engineering karwai - ab na wo sapna na ye career. Dono taraf se haar when you compromised and it still didn't work. That regret of what could have been. Kya abhi bhi medical field mein interest hai?
Roz subah uthke sota hoon aaj nahi apply karunga. But phir darr lagta ki ek din miss kiya toh wo hi opportunity miss ho jayegi. Toh phir shuru kar deta. Tired hoon is cycle se.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Roz sote ho break lena but darr hai ki ek din miss kiya toh opportunity miss - toh cycle continue karte ho exhausted hoke bhi. That tiredness when you can't even take break. Are koi nai, one day break won't hurt yaar. Kitne din se continuous kar raha?
Family group chat mein sab apne baccho ki achievements share karte. Mere parents silent rehte. Unka silence speaks volumes. I'm their embarrassment.

Damn, family group mein sabke achievements and your parents silent - that silence louder than words showing you're their embarrassment. That pain when they can't brag about you like others. Have your parents actually said anything or is this what you're feeling?
Kabhi sota hoon sab kuch chhod ke kisi dhaba pe kaam kar loon. Atleast rozana kuch paisa toh aayega. Par degree waste ho jayegi. Confused hoon kya karun.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Dhaba pe kaam karne ka thought kyunki atleast paisa toh aayega daily - but degree waste hone ka guilt. Survival versus dignity ka conflict. Are koi nai, kuch time aur try kar job search mein, phir decide kar. Kya family support karegi is decision ko?
Interview ke liye suit chahiye tha. Borrow kiya friend se. Didn't fit properly. Looked awkward. Even appearance working against me. Can't afford basic professional clothes.

Man, borrowed suit didn't fit and looked awkward - even appearance working against you when you can't afford professional clothes. That disadvantage when basic things like clothing become barriers. So unfair yaar. Did the interview go badly because of this or other reasons?
Maa ne mandir jaake mannat maangi meri job ke liye. Roz jaati hain. Unki faith dekh ke aur guilt hoti. Bhagwan bhi nahi sun raha. Unki prayers waste ho rahi.

Uff mere dost, maa roz mandir jaake praying aur kuch nahi ho raha - unki faith dekh ke guilt aur feeling ki even prayers waste. That helplessness when their devotion not giving results. Koi nai yaar, unki prayers tujhe strength de rahi hain. Kab se roz ja rahi hain?
Group projects mein team lead ban jata tha college mein. Ab khud ko lead nahi kar pa raha. That leadership is gone. Direction lost completely.

Yaar that shift from leading teams to not being able to lead yourself - that loss of direction and leadership when confidence crashed. College mein leader tha, ab khud ko sambhal nahi pa raha. Are koi nai mere dost, tough times change us temporarily. What made you good leader back then?
Applied for government job. Exam mein fail. That was supposed to be backup plan. Now no plan A, no plan B. Completely lost. What next?

Man, government job exam failed when it was backup plan - no plan A, no plan B means completely lost now. That panic when safety net also gone. What next is the scariest question. Can you appear again for the exam or was this last attempt?
Ek company ne final offer diya tha. Background verification mein kuch discrepancy aa gayi. Offer cancel ho gaya. Itne paas tha. Haath se nikal gaya sab kuch.

Arre yaar, final offer tha aur background verification mein issue - offer cancel when you were so close. Haath se nikal jaana when you could taste success already. That's brutal mere dost. Kya discrepancy thi aur kya clear kar sakte ho?
Neighbors got new car. Mere ghar pe scooty bhi nahi afford kar sakte ab. That comparison daily when I see their prosperity. We're going backwards financially.

Yaar that daily reminder when neighbors getting car and you can't afford scooty - that comparison showing you're going backwards while they're prospering. Financial gap widening hurts when it's visible everyday. Koi nai, temporary phase hai. How is your family managing currently?
Sab professionals ban gaye. Main abhi bhi student jaisa dependent hoon. Age badh rahi maturity nahi. Adulting nahi ho pa rahi. Stuck in limbo between student and professional.

Uff mere dost, sab professionals aur tu student jaisa dependent - that limbo when age says adult but situation says student. Adulting nahi ho pa rahi when everyone else has moved on. That's okay yaar, transition ka time different hota hai. Kya ghar waale pressure dete hain is baare mein?
Bhai ne ghar ke liye AC liya. Papa ne bike repair karwayi. Main kuch contribute nahi kar paya. Chhoti chhoti khushiyon mein bhi part nahi le pa raha. Outsider ban gaya.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Bhai AC laya, papa bike repair karwai aur tu kuch contribute nahi kar paya - chhoti khushiyon mein bhi outsider feel hona. That exclusion when you can't participate in family improvements. Koi nai mere dost, tera time bhi aayega. Kya wo log tujhe kuch bolte hain?
College fest mein chief guest aa rahe successful alumni. Main bhi alumni hoon but unsuccessful. Won't attend. Can't face that reminder of what I should have been.

Arre yaar, successful alumni as chief guest and tu bhi alumni but unsuccessful - can't face that reminder of what you should have become. That avoidance when success of others feels like personal failure. Are koi nai, everyone's journey different. Kya koi batchmate contact mein hai?
Started lying about job searching. Tell family I'm applying but actually I'm too depressed to even open laptop. The lying adds more guilt. Vicious cycle.

Man, lying about applying when depression won't let you even open laptop - that guilt of lying adding to existing burden. Vicious cycle when honesty feels impossible but lying hurts too. That's really tough yaar. How long has this been going on?
Chacha ke bete ko job mili. Unke ghar celebration hua. Mere ghar pe koi baat hi nahi karta ab. Silence vs celebration. That contrast is killing me inside.

Uff mere dost, chacha ke ghar celebration aur tere ghar silence - that contrast when their joy highlights your failure. Killing you inside when you see what your house should be celebrating but isn't. Koi nai yaar, tera time bhi aayega. Kya celebration attend kiya tha?
Phone calls se darr lagne laga. Unknown number means potential interview or rejection. Either way anxiety triggers. Stopped picking up unknown numbers completely.

Yaar that phone anxiety when unknown number could be interview or rejection - both triggering panic so stopped picking up completely. But what if it's opportunity calling? That fear making you miss chances maybe. Are koi nai, voicemail check kar sakta. How long has this been happening?
Dekh raha samajh raha kuch nahi samajh aa raha. Everything feels overwhelming and nothing makes sense anymore. Lost all clarity about life and future. Darkness everywhere.

Mere dost, sab overwhelming aur kuch samajh nahi aa raha - clarity completely lost and darkness everywhere feel hota hai. That confusion when future is just fog. Yaar this sounds really heavy. Please talk to someone - counselor ya Tele-MANAS 14416. Tu important hai and need support right now.
Portfolio website banaya showcase karne ke liye. Views zero hain after months. No one cares. Effort waste. Even online presence is invisible.

Man, portfolio website banaya months ago but zero views - no one cares means even online presence invisible. That effort feeling waste when nobody's looking. Arre but yaar, visibility needs promotion. Have you shared it on LinkedIn or with recruiters directly?
Ek saal baad college jaana hai junior batch ko guide karne. Sharam aayegi unemployed hoke advice dena. Hypocrisy lag raha. Kaise face karunga sabko?

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Ek saal baad juniors ko guide karna but khud unemployed - that hypocrisy feel when giving advice you couldn't follow yourself. Face karna embarrassing lagta hai. Are but koi nai, experience se bhi sikha sakta hai na, success se hi nahi. Kya definitely jaana padega?
My self-worth is completely tied to getting a job now. Without it, I feel like I have no value. This can't be healthy but don't know how to change it.

Man, your entire self-worth hanging on getting a job - without it you feel worthless completely. That dependency when identity becomes job status, you know it's not healthy but stuck in it. That's okay to recognize, awareness is first step. When did this start feeling so intense?
Rejection has become so normal now that when I apply I already expect it. Don't even feel hopeful anymore. Just going through motions mechanically.

Damn, rejection so normalized that hope is completely gone - just mechanical applications expecting failure. That numbness when you're protecting yourself from disappointment. But that means you're still trying despite everything. How many applications are you doing daily?
Used to be optimistic person. Now I'm cynical about everything. Job search killed my positivity. Don't recognize myself anymore. Lost who I was.

Damn, going from optimistic to cynical - job search changing your core personality. Not recognizing yourself when struggle steals who you were, that loss is deep. But that person is still in there somewhere, just buried under pain. When did you notice this shift happening?
Gave an interview drunk once because I couldn't handle the anxiety sober. Obviously failed. Hit rock bottom that day. Realized I'm self-sabotaging now.

Man, drinking before interview because anxiety unbearable sober - that rock bottom moment when you knew you're self-sabotaging. That awareness that you're becoming your own enemy is painful. But recognizing it is important. Have you thought about talking to someone about the anxiety?
Decided to take any job even if it's not in my field. Desperation reached peak. Four years of engineering for jobs I could have done without degree. Feels like defeat.

Man, willing to take anything even outside your field - that desperation peak when engineering degree feels useless. Four years studying for jobs that don't need it, that defeat is real. But first job doesn't define career, it's just entry point. What kind of work are you looking at now?
Tried volunteering to build resume. Even NGOs want commitment I can't give because I need to prioritize job search. Can't even do free work properly. Feel useless.

Damn, even volunteering you can't commit to because job search is priority - can't do free work properly makes you feel useless completely. That frustration when even helping others doesn't work out. But prioritizing job search makes sense. What kind of volunteering was it?
Applied to over 700 companies now. Keeping count to motivate myself but it's having opposite effect. 700 attempts and still nothing. Maybe I'm the problem.

Damn, 700 applications and counting to motivate but it's showing how many failures instead - opposite effect when numbers prove nothing's working. Maybe you're the problem starts feeling like truth. But 700 attempts shows persistence at least. What's the response rate been like?
Started comparing myself to literally everyone. Auto driver, delivery boy, shopkeeper. At least they have work. I have a degree and nothing else. Education feels like a curse.

Man, comparing yourself to everyone who's working and feeling they're better off - degree feels like curse when it didn't deliver what it promised. That bitterness when education became burden not blessing. But you're still looking right, haven't given up. What field are you mainly targeting?
Got called for interview in different city. Can't afford travel and stay. Had to decline. Opportunity was there but poverty blocked it. System is designed for people with money.

Damn, interview opportunity but can't afford travel - poverty blocking chances when opportunity finally came. That frustration when system needs money to make money. So unfair. Did you ask them about remote interview option?
Company HR said you're too introverted for this role. My personality is wrong now? Can't change who I am. Feel rejected for existing. How do I fix my fundamental self?

Damn, rejected for being introverted - your personality itself being the problem makes you feel rejected for just existing. Can't change fundamental self so what to do, right? That's painful. But introvert roles exist too, not every job needs extroversion. What kind of role was it?
Watching younger people succeed while I'm stuck. Age gap closing but achievement gap widening. Soon they'll surpass me completely. Racing against time and losing badly.

Man, younger people succeeding while you're stuck - age gap closing but achievement gap widening makes you feel you're losing race against time. That panic when they'll surpass completely. But everyone's timeline is different, comparison won't help. What age group are they?
Tried meditation and yoga for stress. Everyone says it helps. Doesn't work for me. Can't silence my anxious thoughts. Even relaxation techniques are failing.

Man, meditation and yoga not working when everyone swears by it - can't silence anxious thoughts means even relaxation failing you. That frustration when suggested solutions don't help. Different things work for different people. Have you tried talking to someone instead of just meditation?
Mental health counselor bola career stress hai. Par career nahi hoga toh stress toh rahega hi. Chicken and egg problem hai. Kaise solve karun?

Yaar samajh raha hoon. Counselor says career stress but career nahi hai toh stress rahega - wo loop jahan solution problem ke resolve hone pe depend karta hai. That's frustrating when advice doesn't match reality. Kya counselor ne kuch practical suggestion diya tha?
Engineering kar raha hoon but passion music mein hai. Parents ne bohot paisa lagaya hai. Switch karna chahta par guilt aati hai. 3rd year mein hoon, ab kya karun?

Uff yaar, engineering mein hoon but dil music mein - parents ka paisa aur guilt dono sides se kheench rahe. 3rd year tak aa gaye ab switching bigger decision lagti hai. Kab se feel kar raha music mein hi jana chahiye?
I hate my commerce degree. Want to switch to design but everyone says it's risky. Already 22, feel like I'm running out of time. Should I start over or stick with what I have?

Man, hating commerce but design feels risky - and 22 feels like time running out to start over. That pressure when everyone says stick with safe option but heart says something else. What specifically pulls you toward design?
MBA karu ya job first? Dono options hain par dono mein pros cons hain. Confuse ho gaya hoon completely. Har koi alag advice de raha.

Yaar samajh raha hoon. MBA vs job aur har koi different advice - that confusion when both have pros cons. Koi clear answer nahi hai aur decision tera hai finally. Tu khud kya feel karta hai, kaunsa option naturally zyada right lagta?
Job mein experience milega but MBA se better opportunities. Par 2 saal aur padhai ka mann nahi. Thak gaya hoon studying se.

Arre, toh studying se thak gaya hai - wo 2 saal aur investment feel ho raha heavy. Job mein experience immediate hai aur break bhi studying se. Agar thakaan itni hai toh maybe job leke dekh, baad mein MBA kar sakta na. Kya field mein job dhundh raha?
Doctor banna tha bachpan se. Par NEET mein clear nahi hua 2 baar. Ab parents bol rahe engineering karo. Feel like giving up on my dream. Kya sahi hai?

Mere dost, bachpan ka sapna doctor banna but 2 baar NEET clear nahi - ab parents pushing engineering. Dream give up karna forced lag raha hai. That loss when what you wanted slipping away. Kya third attempt ka option hai ya completely closed?
Parents want me to take over family business but I want corporate job. They'll be heartbroken if I refuse. Feeling trapped between duty and desire.

Damn, family business waiting but you want corporate - trapped between duty to parents and your own desire. Their heartbreak if you refuse weighs heavy. That guilt when choosing yourself feels like betraying them. Have you talked to them about what you actually want?
Teaching mein interest hai par salary bohot kam hai. Engineering se zyada kamaunga but khush nahi rahunga. Money vs passion mein fase hue hain.

Yaar teaching mein dil but salary kam - engineering se paisa zyada but khushi nahi. Money vs passion when both matter equally. Uff, tough choice hai. Agar financial pressure nahi hoti toh kya choose karta?
Samajh nahi aa raha kya karna chahiye. Sab options mein interest hai thoda thoda. Kisi ek mein commit nahi kar pa raha. Ye confusion saal bhar se hai.

Arre mere dost, sab options mein thoda interest but kisi ek mein commit nahi - wo paralysis when everything feels equally okay but nothing feels right. Saal bhar se stuck in this confusion. Kya koi ek cheez hai jo subah uthke karne ka mann karta naturally?
Photography enjoy karta hoon but wo career option nahi lagta. Practical nahi hai. Parents bhi nahi manenge.

Toh photography enjoy karte ho naturally but practical nahi lagta aur parents bhi nahi manenge - that dismissal of what you actually enjoy. But yaar, photography bhi career option hai nowadays. Kya explore kiya hai ki kaise photography se earning ho sakti?
Chose engineering because everyone else did. Now realize I have no interest in it. Final year and still don't know what I actually want to do. Feel lost.

Man, chose engineering following others and now final year realizing zero interest - still don't know what you actually want. That lost feeling when degree almost done but clarity zero. When did you first realize engineering wasn't it for you?
Government job vs private job? Sab kehte government mein security hai. Par private mein growth zyada. Kya better hai long term ke liye? Decide nahi kar pa raha.

Yaar government job mein security, private mein growth - dono ke apne benefits aur tu decide nahi kar pa raha kya better long term. That confusion when both paths valid hain. Tu personally kaunsi cheez zyada value karta - security ya growth?
Science stream li thi pressure mein. Arts mein interest tha. Ab regret ho raha. 12th khatam hone wala hai aur college mein bhi yahi continue karna padega shayad.

Uff mere dost, science pressure mein li but arts mein dil tha - ab regret when 12th khatam hone wala aur lagta college mein bhi yahi continue. That trapped feeling when early decision haunting you. Kya college mein arts stream le sakta ya science se hi kuch karna padega?
Started CA but it's too difficult. Want to quit but already invested 2 years. Sunk cost fallacy mein fasa hoon. Chhodu ya continue karu?

Yaar CA tough lag raha aur 2 saal invest kar diye - sunk cost ke chakkar mein quit nahi kar pa raha even though difficult hai. That trap when time invested feels like reason to continue. Difficult kya hai specifically - exams ya interest nahi?
Passion filmmaking mein hai par parents kehte stable career chahiye pehle. They're not wrong but feels like I'm wasting time doing something I don't care about.

Man, passion in filmmaking but parents want stable career first - they're not wrong but feels like wasting time on things you don't care about. That conflict when their logic makes sense but your heart disagrees. What are you studying currently that feels like waste?
Doing BBA because they said business degree is versatile. But every day feels meaningless. Just going through motions.

So BBA because it's versatile but every day feels meaningless - just motions without meaning when heart is elsewhere. That emptiness when you're physically present but mentally checked out. Have you explored filmmaking on the side at all while doing BBA?
Field change karna hai but experience nahi hai new field mein. Entry level pe jaane ka matlab salary cut. Afford nahi kar sakta. Stuck in wrong career.

Arre yaar, field change karna but new field mein experience zero - entry level means salary cut jo afford nahi kar sakte. Stuck in wrong career kyunki financial reality allows nahi. Kaunse field se kaunse field mein jaana chahta?
Everyone says follow your passion but nobody talks about bills. I have passion but also need money. How do people balance both? Feeling very confused.

Damn, everyone preaches follow passion but bills are real - you have passion but also need money to survive. That confusion when idealistic advice meets practical reality. What's the passion and what are you doing currently for money?
Lawyer banna tha but law entrance clear nahi hua. Ab kya karun samajh nahi aa raha. Doosri koi field mein interest nahi. One dream tha wo bhi toot gaya.

Mere dost, lawyer banne ka ek hi dream tha but entrance clear nahi - ab doosri field mein interest nahi aur confuse ki kya karun. That devastation when only dream shatters. Kya dubara attempt ka option hai ya completely move on karna padega?
Coding seekh raha hoon kyunki scope hai. Par boring lagta hai. Interest nahi hai but majboori hai. Kya galat kar raha hoon?
Yaar coding seekh raha scope ke liye but boring aur interest zero - majboori mein kar raha. That question ki galat toh nahi kar raha forcing yourself. Kaunsi cheez mein naturally interest hai tera?
Maa chahti main doctor banu, papa kehte engineer, main writer banna chahta. Teen alag directions. Sabko khush nahi kar sakta. Apne liye choose karna selfish lagta.

Uff mere dost, maa doctor chahti, papa engineer, aur tu writer - teen directions pulling you apart. Sabko khush nahi kar sakte aur apne liye choose karna selfish feel hota. That guilt when your happiness feels like their disappointment. Kaunsa decision teri neend udaa raha sabse zyada?
Writing chhod dena zyada regret laga. Doctor ya engineer ban bhi gaya toh khush nahi rahunga lagta.

Toh writing chhod dena sabse zyada regret laga aur doctor/engineer banne se khushi nahi - that clarity when you know what will haunt you most. Your happiness matters too yaar. Kya parents se directly baat ki hai ki writer banna hai?
Got admission in two colleges. One has better placements, other has course I'm actually interested in. Practical choice vs passion choice. Which one matters more?

Man, two colleges - one with placements, one with passion - that classic practical vs passion dilemma. Both matter differently and choosing means sacrificing one. What does your gut say when you imagine yourself in each place?
Social work mein mann lagta par income bohot kam. Family financially depend karti mujhpe eventually. Passion follow karun ya responsibility sambhalun?

Yaar social work mein dil but income kam aur family depend karegi financially - passion vs responsibility when both critical hain. That burden when choosing yourself feels like abandoning them. Family ki current financial situation kaisi hai?
Ye saal drop leke preparation karun competitive exam ka ya college join kar loon? Ek saal gap risky hai. Confused between playing safe and taking chance.

Arre, drop leke prep karna vs safe college join karna - gap risky but chance bhi hai, safe option mein regret ho sakta. That confusion between security and possibility. Kaunsa competitive exam soch raha aur kitna confident hai crack karne mein?
Three years into pharmacy but realize I want to do psychology. Starting over at 21 feels too late. Everyone my age will graduate when I'm just starting. Age pressure is real.

Damn, three years in pharmacy but want psychology - starting over at 21 feels late when peers will graduate as you begin. That age pressure when comparing timelines. But 21 is still young for starting over. What made you realize psychology is what you want?
Tier 3 college mein hoon. Achhi company mein nahi jaa sakta. Toh higher studies karun ya tier 3 se jo mile wo loon? Confusing hai future.

Yaar tier 3 college aur achhi company ka scope kam - higher studies vs jo mile wo lena, dono options limiting feel hote. Future confusing when starting point disadvantage hai. Kaunsi field mein hai aur kya higher studies realistic option hai financially?
Ek offer hai hand mein but dream company ka result pending. Accept kar loon safe option ya wait karun dream ke liye? Time limit hai decision ka.

Uff mere dost, offer in hand but dream company pending aur time limit - bird in hand vs risk for dream. That pressure when deadline forcing choice. Dream company ka result kab tak aayega aur kitna realistic chance hai?
Everyone in family is doctor or engineer. I want to be chef. They think it's not a real profession. Fighting their expectations while doubting myself too.

Man, family of doctors and engineers and you want chef - they dismiss it as not real profession while you're also doubting yourself. Fighting external expectations while internal doubt eats you. What draws you to being a chef specifically?
Job mein hoon but MBA karne ka mann. Par 2 saal career break risky lagta. Bina MBA ke bhi aage badh sakta maybe. Confuse hoon completely.

Yaar job mein ho but MBA ka mann - 2 saal break risky aur bina MBA ke bhi growth possible. Dono options valid aur confuse ho completely. Job mein kitne time se ho aur kya growth dikh raha current mein?
Scholarship mili hai abroad jaane ki par ghar se door nahi jaana chahta. India mein comfortable hoon. Opportunity chhod dena stupid hai kya?

Arre, scholarship mili abroad but ghar se door nahi jaana - comfortable in India but opportunity chhod dena stupid lagta. That guilt when great chance but doesn't align with comfort. Kya specific dar hai abroad jaane se?
Parents akele hain. Main hi ek beta. Unhe chhod ke jaana guilt deta. Plus adjustment bhi darr lagta naye jagah.

Toh parents akele aur tu ek beta - unhe chhod ke jaane ka guilt heavy hai plus new place adjustment scary. That responsibility versus opportunity conflict. Kya parents ne kuch bola hai is scholarship ke baare mein?
Achhe marks hain but interest nahi hai science mein. Arts lena chahta but marks waste ho jayenge. Intelligence waste karna galat hai kya?

Yaar achhe marks in science but interest nahi - arts lena chahta but lagta marks waste honge. That pressure when intelligence measured by staying in science. But intelligence waste hota ya interest kill hoti, what feels worse to you?
Startup join karu ya established company? Startup mein learning zyada but risk bhi. Established mein stability. First job hai, galat choice nahi karni.

Startup vs established company aur first job hai - startup mein learning aur risk, established mein stability. That pressure when first choice feels defining. Tu personally kaunsi cheez zyada value karta abhi - learning ya stability?
Want to pursue journalism but media jobs are unstable. Parents want me in IT where jobs are plenty. Their fear is making me doubt my choice.

Man, journalism calling you but media unstable - parents pushing IT where jobs secure. Their fear infecting your confidence in your choice. That doubt when practical concerns valid but passion also real. Have you researched journalism career paths realistically?
Civil services prepare karun ya private job? Civil mein years lagte but respect milti. Private mein jaldi paisa but satisfaction nahi. Dono mein kya better?

Yaar civil services vs private job - civil mein years aur respect, private mein quick money but no satisfaction. Dono apne benefits aur koi clear better nahi. Tu long term mein kya dekhna chahta - respect ya paisa ya kuch aur?
2 saal drop le liya competitive exam ke liye. Clear nahi hua. Ab age bhi badh gayi. Fresh start karun nahi samajh aa raha. Kahan se shuru karun life?

Mere dost, 2 saal drop liya but exam clear nahi - age badh gayi aur fresh start kahan se karun wo confusion. That lost feeling when big investment didn't pay off. Kya third attempt ka option hai ya ab completely move on karna padega?
Interest hai research mein but PhD mein paisa nahi. Job loon toh research chhutna padega. Academia vs industry, heart vs wallet ka fight.

Yaar research mein interest but PhD means no money - job means research chhutna. Academia vs industry when heart and wallet wanting different things. That pull between intellectual satisfaction and financial need. Kya research part-time possible hai job ke saath?
Friends are all going into tech. I'm interested in humanities but feel left out. Am I making a mistake going against the trend? Feeling very alone in this choice.

Man, friends all in tech and you humanities - feeling left out and questioning if going against trend is mistake. That loneliness when your path diverges from everyone. But trend doesn't define right choice for you. What specifically draws you to humanities?
Literature and philosophy fascinate me. But there's no clear career path like there is in tech. That uncertainty scares me.

So literature and philosophy fascinate you naturally but career path unclear unlike tech - that uncertainty scary when passion doesn't come with roadmap. Valid fear. Have you looked into what humanities grads actually do career-wise?
CA kar raha hoon par passion stock market mein. Parents ne bohot paisa invest kiya CA coaching mein. Switch karna betrayal lagta unke sacrifice ka.

Uff yaar, CA kar raha but passion stock market - parents ka paisa coaching mein aur switch betrayal feel hota unke sacrifice ka. That burden when their investment feels like chain. Kitna time ho gaya CA start kiye aur kitna baaki hai?
Mera sapna tha scientist banna. Par science mein scope kam dikhta India mein. Engineering safe option lagta. Compromise kar raha dreams se.

Yaar scientist banna tha but scope kam dikhta India mein - engineering safe option aur compromise kar raha dreams. That resignation when reality forces practical over passion. Kya research scientist ka koi realistic path explore kiya hai tune?
Multiple offers hain different cities mein. Ghar ke paas job ya better opportunity door wala? Family vs career growth. Kaunsa choose karun?

Arre mere dost, ghar ke paas job vs door wali better opportunity - family closeness vs career growth. That classic dilemma when both matter. Kya family physically dependent hai tujhpe ya emotional closeness ka matter hai?
Doing masters because didn't get job after bachelors. Not really interested in academics. Just delaying the inevitable. Should I drop out or continue?

Man, masters as backup because no job - not interested in academics, just delaying reality. That question whether to drop out or continue when heart's not in it. How far along are you in the masters program?
Bhai doctor hai, behen engineer. Main arts mein hoon. Family mein black sheep ban gaya. Unki success dekh ke lagta galat field choose kiya.

Yaar bhai doctor, behen engineer aur tu arts - black sheep feel hona when their success constant reminder. Galat field choose kiya lagta comparing yourself. But arts mein kya kar raha specifically aur kya enjoy karta hai?
Animation mein career banana hai but Indian market mein scope kam hai. Parents kehte foreign jaao but afford nahi kar sakte. Dreams practical nahi hain.

Uff mere dost, animation ka passion but Indian market limited - foreign jana chahiye but afford nahi. Dreams aur practical reality ka gap when money blocking path. Kya India mein animation industry ka kuch explore kiya realistically?
Thoda explore kiya. Freelancing scope hai but initial struggle bohot. Stable nahi hai. Parents stable chahte hain.

Toh freelancing scope hai but initial struggle aur instability - parents stable chahte when you want creative freedom. That gap between their security need and your passion pursuit. Kya part-time stable job aur side mein animation possible lagta?
Sab kehte versatile bano, multiple skills seekho. Par main ek cheez mein expert banna chahta. Jack of all trades ya master of one? Kya sahi approach hai?

Yaar sab versatile bano bolte but tu expert banna chahta ek cheez mein - jack of all trades vs master of one. Both approaches valid depending on field aur personality. Kaunsi cheez mein expert banna chahta specifically?
Got placed in core company but salary low. Friend in IT earning double. Should I switch to IT for money even though I studied mechanical? Confused about priorities.

Man, placed in core but low salary - friend in IT earning double makes you question switching fields for money. Studied mechanical but IT pays more. That confusion when qualification says one thing but wallet says another. Do you have any interest in IT or just money pulling?
Papa retire ho rahe 2 saal mein. Unhe secure dekhna chahta financial mein. Toh stable government job better ya high paying private? Responsibility vs ambition.

Mere dost, papa retiring soon aur unhe secure dekhna hai - stable government job vs high paying private. Responsibility toward parents vs personal ambition. That weight when your choice affects their security. Kya government job realistic option hai aur private mein kitna high paying milega?
Mujhe samajh nahi aata main kisme achha hoon. Koi particular talent nahi hai. Average hoon sab mein. Career kaise choose karun jab strength hi pata nahi?

Yaar koi particular talent nahi aur average sab mein feel hota - strength pata nahi toh career choose karna harder. That confusion when no clear direction from abilities. Kya koi ek cheez hai jo karte time time pass ho jata naturally?
Environment science padhna chahta climate change ke liye kuch karna. But job opportunities bohot limited. Idealism vs practicality ka fight ho raha.

Arre, environment science aur climate change ka passion but job limited - idealism vs practicality when world-changing goals meet career reality. That conflict between purpose and paycheck. Kya environment field mein realistic options dekhe hain?
LinkedIn pe sabki perfect career journey dikhayi deti. Mere paas clear path nahi. Feeling like I'm the only one who's confused and directionless. Everyone else seems sorted.

Man, LinkedIn making everyone look sorted with perfect journeys and you feel like only confused one - directionless when everyone seems to have it figured out. But that's just highlights, most people are figuring it out too. What's making you feel most directionless right now?
Fashion designing mein interest hai. Par maa kehti ladkiyon ka field hai. Papa kehte artistic fields mein paisa nahi. Gender stereotypes aur financial pressure dono side se.

Uff yaar, fashion designing chahta but maa gender stereotype kar rahi aur papa financial concern - dono sides se pressure when passion meets societal norms and money fears. Double barrier. Tu genuinely interested hai ya bas explore karna chahta?
Degree khatam hone ko hai. Abhi tak nahi pata kya karna hai life mein. Classmates ke plans ready hain. Main blank hoon. Darr lag raha graduation ke baad ka.

Yaar degree almost done aur abhi tak blank jab classmates ready - that fear when graduation approaching but no plan. Everyone sorted aur tu confused. Kya koi field ya activity hai jo naturally interest hai ya complete blank?
Bhai ne family business sambhala. Pressure hai main bhi join karun. Par corporate mein jaana chahta experience ke liye. Family duty vs personal growth confused hoon.

Mere dost, bhai family business mein aur pressure tu bhi join kar - but corporate experience chahiye. Family duty pulling vs personal growth pushing. That obligation when business waiting but you want different path. Kya family directly bol rahi join karne ko?
Direct nahi bolte but expectation hai unspoken. Bhai bhi subtle hints deta. Feel guilty thinking about saying no.

Toh unspoken expectation aur subtle hints - guilt without direct pressure, which is sometimes heavier. Saying no feels like betrayal when they're not even demanding directly. Have you considered maybe doing corporate for few years then joining business with experience?
Entrepreneur banna chahta but zero business knowledge. MBA karun ya seedha start karun? Learning vs doing. Kaunsa approach better hai startup ke liye?

Yaar entrepreneur banna but knowledge zero - MBA for learning vs seedha startup. Both have merit aur koi right answer nahi. Tu risk-taker hai ya structured learning prefer karta? That might guide the choice.
Changed my major twice already. Now in third year and still not sure. People judge me for being indecisive. Maybe I'll never figure out what I want. Feeling like a failure.

Man, changed major twice and still unsure - people judging your indecisiveness making you feel like failure. That doubt whether you'll ever figure it out. But exploring isn't failing, it's searching. What made you change the first two times?
Acche marks hain medical mein but interest zero hai. Parents ka sapna tha doctor banu. Ab MBBS kar raha hoon without any passion. 5 saal aur yahi haalat.

Uff mere dost, acche marks the toh medical li but interest zero - parents ka sapna living kar raha bina passion. 5 saal aur same haalat ka dar. That emptiness when doing something only for others. Kab se feel kar raha ye disconnect?
Sports mein career banana hai. National level player hoon. But parents kehte backup plan chahiye. Engineering kar raha reluctantly. Missing practice for classes.

Man, national level player but parents want backup - engineering reluctantly while missing practice for classes. That sacrifice when backup killing the main dream. How much is engineering affecting your sports performance?
Sab options explore kiye. Har field thodi pasand hai thodi nahi. Perfect fit nahi mil raha. Kab tak dhundhu? Kahi pe settle karna padega.

Yaar har field explore ki but perfect fit nahi - thoda pasand thoda nahi everywhere. Kab tak dhundhu when settling somewhere inevitable lagta. Maybe perfect doesn't exist and good enough is okay? Sabse kam dislike kaunsa field hai?
Sirf paise ke liye field choose kiya. Khushi nahi hai. Ab regret ho raha. Money mil raha but satisfaction zero. Wrong priority set kiya lagta.

Arre, paise ke liye choose kiya but khushi zero - money mil raha but satisfaction nahi aur regret. Wrong priority feel hota when you have what you wanted but it's not enough. Kitne time se is field mein ho?
2 saal ho gaye. Salary achhi hai but roz jate time mann nahi karta. Weekends ka wait karta rehta bas.

Toh 2 saal aur salary achhi but mann nahi karta daily - weekends ka wait when weekdays painful. Living for weekends means not living fully. Kya koi specific field hai jismein interest hai ya bas ye chhod dena chahta?
Meri girlfriend doctor ban rahi. Main confused hoon apne career mein. She's so focused and I'm lost. Feel inferior. Relationship mein bhi insecurity aa rahi career ki wajah se.

Yaar girlfriend focused doctor ban rahi aur tu lost - that comparison making you feel inferior. Career confusion bleeding into relationship insecurity. Her clarity highlighting your confusion more. Kya tumne usse share kiya ye feeling?
Acting ka passion hai but realistic nahi lagta career option. Commercial arts mein jaun toh atleast creative field mein rahunga. Compromise hai ya smart choice?

Acting passion but unrealistic lagta - commercial arts compromise ya smart choice when staying in creative field. That middle ground between dream and reality. Have you actually tried pursuing acting to know if it's realistic or just assuming?
Data science popular hai aajkal. Sab shift kar rahe. Main bhi karun ya apni mechanical mein hi rahun? FOMO ho raha trend miss karne ka.

Yaar data science trend aur sab shift kar rahe - FOMO when you're in mechanical. That pressure to jump on bandwagon. But trend following vs staying in your field, both have risks. Kya data science mein genuine interest hai ya bas trend dekh ke?
Tier 1 college se average student vs tier 3 college se topper. Main tier 3 topper hoon. Better college jaun lower rank pe ya yahi rahun top pe? Confused about what matters more.

Uff mere dost, tier 1 average vs tier 3 topper - college brand vs rank ka confusion. Both matter differently aur choose karna hard. Long term mein kya chahiye - network and brand ya confidence from being top?
Counselor ne aptitude test diya. Results show I'm good at things I hate. Not good at things I love. Should I follow aptitude or passion? Science says one thing, heart says another.

Man, aptitude test showing you're good at what you hate - bad at what you love. Science vs heart when data contradicts desire. That confusion when natural ability doesn't align with interest. What does the test say you're good at?
Chacha ne apni company mein position offer kiya. Secure hai but growth limited. Bahar opportunity zyada but risk bhi. Family politics bhi involved. Confused completely.

Yaar chacha ka offer secure but growth limited - bahar mein opportunity aur risk dono, plus family politics. Multiple layers of confusion when professional and personal mixed. Kya chacha directly pressure kar rahe ya offer diya bas?
Har kisi ne apna raasta dhundh liya. Main abhi bhi explore kar raha. 24 ka hoon aur settled nahi. Friends joke marte professional student bulate. Hurt hota hai.

Arre mere dost, 24 pe explore kar raha jab sab settled - friends joke karte professional student bulate aur hurt hota. That sting when your search becomes their entertainment. Exploring isn't failure yaar. Kya explore kar raha currently?
Different internships kar raha different fields mein. Kuch stick nahi kar raha. Feel like wasting time.
Toh internships try kar raha but kuch stick nahi - time waste feel hota when nothing clicking. But elimination is also progress, knowing what you don't want. Kaunsa field sabse better laga ab tak?
Parents retired hain. Pension se ghar chal raha. Main career switch karna chahta but financially risky. Unki security vs meri happiness ka choice.

Yaar parents retired on pension aur tu career switch chahta - financially risky when they're dependent. Their security vs your happiness when both critical. How risky is the switch financially and for how long?
Read somewhere that first job doesn't matter, you can pivot later. But also hear first job sets trajectory. Which is true? Should I take any job or wait for right one?

Man, contradicting advice - first job doesn't matter vs it sets trajectory. Both sound convincing and you're stuck deciding whether to take anything or wait. Truth is probably somewhere in middle. What kind of offers do you have right now?
Music production seekhna chahta professionally. Par India mein scope limited hai. YouTube pe try karun ya proper course? Investment vs organic growth confused hoon.

Yaar music production passion but India mein limited scope - YouTube organic vs proper course investment ka confusion. Both paths valid aur different risks. Kya abhi kuch music production try kiya hai apne level pe?
Bhut sochne ke baad bhi samajh nahi aa raha kya karna chahiye. Dimaag kharab ho gaya hai options dekhte dekhte. Har raasta achha bhi lagta bura bhi. Koi clarity nahi hai.

Samajh raha hoon mere dost. Bhut socha but clarity nahi - har option achha bhi bura bhi dikhta aur dimaag kharab. Overthinking ne confusion aur badha diya. Ek kaam kar, agar ek decision lena hi padega abhi toh kaunsa lega gut feeling se?
Rone lagta hoon kabhi kabhi career ke baare mein sochte. Itna stress hai decision ka. Ek galat choice aur life barbaad. Pressure handle nahi ho raha.

Arre yaar, rone lagta sochte career - that pressure when one wrong choice feels like life barbaad. Stress itna heavy hai ki emotional breakdown aa raha. But one choice doesn't define everything yaar, life linear nahi hai. Kaunsa decision immediate lena hai jo itna stress de raha?
Everyone has a backup plan. I don't even have a main plan. Seeing peers with plan A, B, C and I'm at zero. Feeling very behind and unprepared.

Man, peers with plan A, B, C and you at zero - that behind feeling when everyone seems over-prepared. Unprepared for life when others have backups for backups. But too many plans can also mean fear, not clarity. What's stopping you from making even one plan?
Mechanical engineer hoon but environment activist banna chahta. Completely opposite fields. Degree waste hogi switch karne pe. Par current field mein soul nahi hai.

Yaar mechanical engineer but environment activist banna - opposite fields aur degree waste feel hoga. Current mein soul nahi but switching means starting over. Can you bridge both somehow - like environmental engineering or is activism specifically what calls you?
Dost ne startup kiya, fail hua, phir dobara kiya. Main ek baar bhi nahi kar paya start. Risk lene ki himmat nahi hai. Safe choices kar raha aur regret bhi.

Uff, dost ne fail hoke bhi dobara try kiya aur tu start bhi nahi kar paya - risk lene ki himmat nahi but safe choices ka regret hai. That trap between fear and regret. Kya specific rok raha tujhe try karne se?
Financial security nahi hai. Fail hua toh recover karna mushkil hoga. Family bhi depend karti hai mujhpe.

Toh financial security nahi aur family depend karti - fail hone ka afford nahi kar sakte when responsibilities hai. That's valid fear yaar, not cowardice. Kya small scale mein try kar sakte side mein while keeping stable income?
Competitive exam prepare kar raha 3 saal se. Clear nahi ho raha. Ab doubt hai ki yahi karna chahiye ya nahi. But 3 years chhod ke kya karunga? Sunk cost.

Mere dost, 3 saal invest kiye exam mein but clear nahi - doubt hai continue karna ya quit but 3 years chhod dena hard. Sunk cost fallacy real hai. Apart from time invested, do you still want this or just continuing because you started?
